title: Zoe Kravitz as Catwoman: Jason Momoa 'stoked' for role; Anne Hathaway, Michelle Pfeiffer react
text:
CLOSE

Zoe Kravitz has been cast as Catwoman, according to reports. (Photo: ANGELA WEISS, AFP via Getty Images)

If there's anyone that's super excited over Zoë Kravitz landing the role of Catwoman in Matt Reeves' upcoming "Batman" film, it's her stepdad, Jason Momoa.

The proud father shared his enthusiasm on Instagram by posting a photo withKravitz, accompanied by a sweet, congratulatory message.

"I’m so proud of u zozo bear. On and off screen OHANA," the "Aquaman" star wrote. "DC WB ohana Lola and Wolfies big sister is CAT WOMAN😍😍😍 Unbelievable so freaking stoked. Your going to have so much fun Aloha P bear."

The "Big Little Lies" star responded to the post and said she was looking forward to spending time with her newfound DC family member.

"LOVE YOU PAPABEAR! love that aquaman and catwomen spend the holidays together from now on," Kravitz wrote.

USA TODAY has confirmed that Kravitz is set to play Catwoman alongside Robert Pattinson's Batman in the upcoming movie.

On Monday, the film's director tweeted out a gif of Kravitz, furthering feline fervor about the actress playing Selina Kyle.

Michelle Pfeiffer, who played Catwoman in "Batman Returns," offered up some practical advice for Kravitz.

"Make sure whilst designing the costume they consider how you're going to go to the bathroom," Pfeiffer said on "Good Morning America."

Another Catwoman alum, Anne Hathaway, congratulated Kravitz on landing the coveted role.

"The biggest congrats to @zoeisabellakravitz on landing the role of a lifetime," Hathaway wrote alongside a photo of Kravitz. "Well, one life anyway...⁣⁣Enjoy the ride, Selena."

description: Jason Momoa and former Catwomen Michelle Pfeiffer and Anne Hathaway shared congratulatory messages with Zoe Kravitz for her role role as Catwoman.
